Class ContactsApp

java.lang.Object
ContactsApp
public class ContactsApp extends Object
The main class of ContactsApp, that is called to run the app.
Author:
Harri Salminen

  • Constructor Details

    • ContactsApp

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      After running java on ContactsApp, this method is called and a new ContactsManager object is created before showing the menu, where all the contacts will be stored to do operations on them. After creation of the object, it is sent to FileHelpers readFile to populate the ArrayList of the object with contact info already in the contacts.txt database. After that the menu shows and user can start doing CRUD operations on the contacts.
      Parameters:
      args - Arguments given on running the app. Not used on ContactsApp.

    • mainMenu

      public static void mainMenu()
      Main menu method for ContactsApp. Here the user is displayed the different options on what they can do with the contacts.

    • mainMenuSwitch

      public static void mainMenuSwitch()
      Helper method for mainMenu. User is asked to choose an option to perform. With the help of askOption and askNumber, user can only input valid integers. Then a switch case is used to call the appropriate methods.

    • askOption

      public static int askOption(int max, int min)
      Method used to ask what action the user wants to perform in the menus. It takes the maximum and minimum integer parameters the user should be able to choose, and utilizes askNumber for validation. Returns the valid option as integer number.
      Parameters:
      max - Maximum allowed integer for user to choose from.
      min - Minimum allowed integer for user to choose from.
      Returns:
      The option as integer the user wants to perform.

    • askNumber

      public static int askNumber(int max, int min)
      Method to ask a valid number in the range [min, max] from user. It validates the input, and if the number doesn't fit the range or is not number at all, an exception is thrown, which is handled at askOption.
      Parameters:
      max - Maximum allowed integer
      min - Minimum allowed integer
      Returns:
      Valid integer from range [min, max]
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if integer isn't on the range [min, max] or the input parsing to integer fails.
